page.title: 18CHANGE: HOUSING, GILLINGHAM
page.content: {We interviewed ten people who had lived in the area for over 40 years. These are the changes they told us about. The town was much smaller in 1935. Shaftesbury Road council{houses and Orchard Road did exist but there were no houses at Peacemarsh, Bay and Commonmead Lane. Where Lodbourne Green{Shops}are now a fair was held annually. The doctor's house in the High Street made way for a garage; the ambulance and fire stations and two {cinemas}have gone _ one was on the site of Gateway's. Bracher's, Kite's, Braddick's, Maddock's, Suttle's and Stewart's remain the same. Where Johnson's, the chemist is now there used to be a barber's called Peaches, a hardware and sweet shop called Fishes' where Pothecary's is now and Higham's tea shop on the site of the fish and chip shop.
